headline: Stuffed Green Peppers
description: These stuffed green peppers with ground beef, rice, and Cheddar cheese take just 30 minutes to bake in the oven for a delicious weeknight meal.

video.description: See how to make 5-star stuffed peppers.
video.name: Stuffed Green Peppers I

name: Stuffed Green Peppers
recipeIngredient: 1 (14.5 ounce) can whole peeled tomatoes, chopped

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cut the tops off bell peppers and remove the seeds. Cook bell peppers in boiling water for 5 minutes; drain. Sprinkle salt inside each bell pepper and set aside.

Place ground beef and onion in a large skillet over medium heat; cook and stir until beef is browned, about 5 minutes. Drain off excess fat and season with salt and pepper. Stir in tomatoes, 1/2 cup water, rice, and Worcestershire sauce; reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer until rice is tender, about 15 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in cheese.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Stuff each bell pepper with beef and rice mixture; arrange open-side up in a baking dish.
Combine tomato soup with just enough water in a medium bowl to make the soup a gravy consistency; pour over the bell peppers and cover with aluminum foil.
Bake in the preheated oven until heated through and cheese is melted and bubbly, about 25 to 30 minutes.

review.reviewBody: The recipe is so yummy. The only changes I made was to turn it into a casserole and I only used 1 medium bell pepper. I chopped and sauted the bell pepper and the onion with the ground beef and then followed the rest of the recipe. I poured the cooked ingredients into a sprayed casserole dish and added more cheddar cheese to the top. I then baked it for 20-30 minutes until the the cheese was bubbly and started to brown. (350 degrees) I will be making this regularly. My picky-eater husband loved it!
Made these for supper last night. Super easy to make and really, really nice!
I used cook rice and tomato paste. Delicious!

Generally, this is a tasty recipe with a an adjustment or two, or three. As has been suggested, I would add an extra tsp of Worcestershire to the meat mixture. I used Rao’s Tomato Basil Soup instead of a regular can of tomato soup. I poured it directly from the jar over the peppers without diluting. I added extra cheddar cheese on top of the peppers and then baked. I would suggest playing with the baking time. 30 minutes at 350 degrees didn’t seem long enough.

Made this for first time and it's very easy. I like the one-pan cooking method with adding the rice in with the meat. Instead of celery I took the tops of the peppers and reserved the good parts, chopped them up and probably had 1 cup of green pepper to add to the meat and onions. Flavors are a little bland so to add a little pizzaz to the flavor, my son suggested adding taco seasoning to the meat next time. Will do! But very savory comfort food!

Loved this recipe, only change i made was to add some of the cheese to the bottom of the peppers, then filled them 1/2 with the filling, added some tomato soup, then more filling, soup and cheese. I subbed diced tomatoes for the whole tomatoes,
I've made this recipe twice and liked it. But I can't figure out why it calls for two cans of soup. Even the video shows just a spoonful of soup being put on top of the peppers.

I wish I hadn’t added uncooked rice, I thought that sounded odd. The rice isn’t getting tender enough and I’ve been simmering way longer than the recipe called for. Praying it tenders up in the oven or this whole dish and effort will be ruined.
This recipe was so good. We added more onions and diced green peppers.
Quick and Easy! I could eat a plate of the filling by itself!

The stuffed peppers turned out extremely well. The only variation I made was I sautéed 1 small onion with 1/2 green pepper, both finely chopped. I added the vegetables to the meat mixture along with 2 teaspoons Worcestershire sauce.
Very easy and quick. My husband loved it!

Followed this recipe exactly. So good. I guess I put a little extra cheddar cheese on them in the final 5 minutes. My mom used to top her stuffed green peppers with ketchup and I wasn't sure the tomato soup would be as good, but I really liked it.
It tastes very good. Though it took an hour for the rice to become tender. I will cook the rice first next time.
Been making it this way for years. My only change is the w sauce, I add that to taste, so a lot

This is my go to recipe for Stuffed Green Peppers. I'VE MADE THIS 5-6 TIMES, AND, It turns our PERFECT EVERYTIME. It's on my favorites page, so I do not forget it My husband is a Very picky eater - and ABSOLUTELY LOVES this recipe :) 
THANK YOU !!!!!

I wish I could give this a 3.5 not just a three. I like the overall concept and I have never boiled the peppers before ahead of time and I like that. What didn't impress me is how bland they were until I added extra salt, pepper, garlic, crushed red pepper, oregano, basil and cheese. I kind of liked The tomato soup topping but over that is where I added the extra cheese. By the time I got finished it was just right!
made this following the recipe exactly.. it was completely flavorless.
Delicious! Did not make any changes.

Great recipe for entire family! Easy and I skipped blanching as we lover the crispness of peppers. Just cook them around 10 min longer and they will be wonderful! Placed the previously sliced top of each pepper as the "lid" and served! They looked great and the extra shredded cheese on top under the lid was an extra bonus! Start with this recipe and make all the changes as your taste buds dictate!
Awesome recipe. Also really into spicy ramen rn so would be so yum to stuff it with that, too! FUSION!
Wonderful, I added hot sauce.
Very good. I should of added more tomato sauce

I made this by using around 1 1/3 pounds of meat. 3/4 ground burger, 1/4 hot pork sausage and 1/3 pound of chorizo. Oooo Laaa Laaa!! I cooked my onion and garlic with the meat and drained well. I halved a mixture of multicolored and green peppers - cooked my jasmine rice separately in beef broth - added just a bit of sharp cheddar cheese on the inside of the peppers, then put in the filling, then put cheddar and Parmesan on top. Cheddar was in the filling as well. I used double Worcestershire, oregano, basil and Italian seasonings. Nom nom!

Hi, i just made this and added a few things the reviewers suggested like basil, garlic, italian seasonings. I also substitued Rao's marinara sauce instead of the soup. It filled 4 large peppers for me. YUM!

I have made this recipe twice now, and on the second time I used already cooked rice leftover from another recipe. The first time I didn’t cook it and it didn’t cook thoroughly enough. Much better this time!
Stuffed Green Peppers are one of my husband”s favorites and he absolutely loved this one! It was easy to make and I followed the directions as written.

I am making this for the second time... It is great! The only thing I changed was I used a can of f ire roasted tomatoes instead of the regular ones... And a little extra cheese!!! Great leftovers too!!!!
Delicious! Instead of the tomato soup for “gravy,” I used homemade tomato sauce from my summer garden.

Very good! My husband loved it! I used pork sausage, didn't have the tomatoes or the soup. Used tomato paste and water. I cut the peppers lengthwise and filled them with the filling. Added a little water to the bottom and the peppers were perfect and the mixture was delicious. Added more cheese to the top and baked 5 minutes more. Yum!!
These were good but thought the filling lacked in flavor. My hubby like them. Next time I will add more seasoning and some garlic cloves.

I added one clove of garlic to mixture. Used 1/2 pound of hamburger and 1/2 pound of chorizo. Used beef broth in place of water. I had only enough mixture to stuff 3 large peppers. Spread 1/3 of soup in bottom of casserole and spooned the remainder over the tops of the peppers. This a great recipe.

I took the green pepper around the stem that I cut off and diced it and sautéed it with the onion. I also mixed the soup right away with the tomato’s rice and water instead of pouring it over the top. I also added chili powder, garlic salt, and onion powder to add some taste.

This recipe was easy to follow and produced a dinner my husband thoroughly enjoyed. It was flavorful, held together well, and was quite filling. I simply sprinkled cheese on the top for decorating. He's still smiling...
I made these tonight except I substituted tomatoe sauce for the tomatoe soup. On a scale of 1-10 these were a 10 with my husband and I.
Quick, easy and delicious. No changes - and will make again!

I liked this recipe but i added 1/2 teaspoon pepper, 1 teaspoon salt and 1 teaspoon italian seasoning to the meat and layered the meat, cheese and tomato soup in the pepper. Also, the rice took 1 cup of water and 25 mins to cook until tender.
This was so very delicious! Very filling. wouldn't change a thing, except to make more.

Absolutely delicious and well ballanced, but I did make some changes, and additions because of comments I read.

I bought diced canned tomatoes instead of whole tomatoes
I used a TBS of Worcestershire sauce instead of tsp
I added 1.5 TBS of diced, canned jalepeneo peppers, it was enough to give it a building spice that didn't overpower the dish.
Very good. I also halved the peppers. I used garlic salt instead of regular salt. Excellent flavor - reminds me of the stuffed peppers my mom used to make!
The whole family loved it!
The recipe turned out great it now a family favorite
Great recipe. My husband loved it.
I would rate it a 3.5. I added more rice and salsa, needed a little kick. GOOD!

These were awesome, I am saving this to my favorites and will make it again. Looking at the ingredients and the reviews I made a few changes. I added two cloves of minced garlic while sautéing the onions and ground beef. I doubled the Worcestershire sauce. I added some sprinkles of red pepper flakes. I filled the peppers halfway, added tomato sauce, filled the rest of the way and added the rest of the tomato sauce. Some people couldn’t understand why you wouldn’t use a can of diced tomatoes vs whole peeled tomatoes, I think because whole tomatoes chopped have a lot more juice so the rice can soak up
The beef mixture was a little bland, simply by adding a little more salt the recipe was greatly enhanced. It does read salt to taste. I will also be adding some garlic next time.
Love this recipe! As a diabetic, I replaced the rice with par-cooked barley (much lower glycemic index) plus added a little crushed garlic. Part of the rotation now as the family loves these peppers!
We all loved them. Topped with mozzarella for the last 5 minutes.

These are very good! My husband loved them! I followed the directions almost exactly as stated. The only minor differences I made were: (1) I used fire-roasted diced tomatoes with garlic instead of whole tomatoes and then cutting them up and (2) I had to add a cup more of water (making it 1-1/2 cups) to have enough liquid to cook the rice with the ground meat. ( I'm wondering if the 1/2 cup is a misprint. ) The mixture was moist and the rice was just shy of being done before I spooned it into the peppers. Also, though the recipe said it would stuff 6 bell peppers, I was only able to fill 5 but mine were pretty big so maybe that was the difference. This is a keeper! Thanks for the recipe!

Love, love, love this recipe. I used red and yellow bell peppers instead of green only because I prefer them over the green. The stuffing was fabulous and super easy to put together. This will be my go-to stuffed pepper recipe, for sure!

It's very simple very easy to make, though I would recommend adding just a little bit more water when you're cooking the rice. Also I'd recommend using 8 bell peppers using 6 I always have extra filling left over

So good even my kids (5, 8) loved it. I used brown rice and cooked it prior to mixing with the browned meat. I also only used one can of tomato soup. I also used one can of diced tomatoes (with mild chili) and one small can of tomato sauce. It was delicious.

Turned out great! Husband and picky kids devoured it! I used beef broth to add to the rice/beef mixture as well as to thin out the tomato soup for extra flavor - otherwise did not make any adjustments. Definitely a keeper!
Used vegetarian meatless crumbles and it still came out great. Added a little bit of taco seasoning and it really set it off. Tasted even better the second day.

Good recipe, I didn’t have tomato soup so used two cans of tomatoes instead, mixed some cheese in the ground beef/tomato/rice and put the rest on the top the last five minutes. Make sure to cover relatively tightly or the rice won’t cook well. Family really liked it.

this is great. I mixed my tomato sauce with black pepper and fresh dill. although I think these could really use a lime or lemon flavor. my dad who grew up eating these told me there was too too much tomato sauce and I have to agree. I'm not sure topping them off with the sauce at the last step is the best idea either.

I think this is a great recipe. I ended up doubling the batch and adding ground beef and ground sausage. I had to omit the cheese because of an allergy but it was still great. I added cheese the next day and threw it in the microwave and it was even better.

This is a great recipe! I’ve made mine a little different. I added tomatoe paste at thee bottom of the peppers and I added some at the top and added more cheese at the top as well, bcuz my family are cheese lovers I also added some garlic salt and Creole seasoning for the taste. And I gotta admit it tastes delicious
Very good!
No changes made. They were great!
I made this dish tonight but excluded the tomato soup and used marinara sauce. My teenage kids and husband Loved it!
My husband and I loved it. Will definitely make it again.
I have made this several times and next time I am going to use rotel as someone suggested to add a little extra kick. I’ve used orzo once and it was delicious as well. Half the tomato sauce!

Was soo good!! Added garlic, used Velvetta shredded cheese (yes makes a difference, soo creamy), used canned petite tomatoes with liquid, used tomato sauce instead of tomato soup and topped it with shredded cheese as well. Will be making again!! Yummmm
Very good! I did add a tsp of Italian season and garlic powder

This has become a comfort food favorite. My Italian touch:
half ground beef and half sweet Italian sausage, 1 lb each. All other ingredient quantities in the recipe stay the same...of course, I add more cheese..and tomato sauce takes the place of the tomato soup diluted with water. Delilcious!
An excellent stuffed pepper recipe. More like Mom’s than any other I have tried. Easy to make and easy to eat!

Holy . I’m a beginner when it comes to cooking and I tried this recipe and followed it every step of the way. It came out better than I expected. I’m still patting myself on the back. It was sooooooooo good!

The only difference was I didn’t drain the hamburger fat. I used 87% lean hamburger and wanted the fat in it. I know, I know.....”fat isn’t good for you, blah, blah, blah.” 

I’m good with eating lean most of the time, but with this recipe I wanted the fat because it adds so much flavor. It was excellent and I have no regrets. 

This recipe is a keeper.

Followed exactly. 2 stars based on having to adapt. Need 1 C. water for 1/2 C. rice. This is a standard measurement and I knew better and had to add the additional 1/2 C. as rice was burning/sticking to bottom. I would use 2lbs hamburger next time and double tomatoes. There wasn’t enough filling to fill 6 peppers. After water bath and 30 min in oven, peppers were still crisp. Need longer cooking. I would add garlic/onion powder next time too. This is a basic cabbage roll recipe as well.

I followed this recipe step by step but the peppers were way too tough for my taste. The filling was good and my family all liked it. I only used one can of tomato soup and it was plenty. Next time I would make these in the instant pot or slow cooker because I like my peppers to be very very tender.
Very Good Recipe !!!! I made as written except I microed it for a 1 1/2 min.
My kids love this. I use petite diced tomatoes, a little extra Worcestershire & yellow, red and orange peppers. Best stuffed pepper recipe.

Easy ingredients and directions. They tasted even better the 3rd day ! Made all six as directions suggested. But used bread pans and put 3 green peppers in each. It’s just my husband and myself, so breaking them up was perfect. They stored well in frig with plastic wrap .
Made it just as shown, loved it

I tried this recipe as I wanted to try something different from my traditional peppers with barley and lots of sauce inside the meat mixture. It was ok. Bland and a bit too dry for me but my son liked it.
These turned out Amazing! I replaced ground beef with Ground Turkey. I also used diced tomatoes instead of a whole tomato. My husband and I loved them.
Didn't add the worshishire sauce. Added a tomato soup instead
I have made this a lot and it is wonderful. I make it in my instapot
Super yummy!! We (by accident) put all the stuffing ingredients together and simmered for 20 minutes....easier and still delicious!
I added garlic and onions to the hamburger while cooking. I also added some cheese in the middle and on top! It was delish
Turned out better than expected! Made it exactly as it is written.
I added 1/2 more pound of ground beef. Turned out great! I will make it again!
Doubled the recipe for eight large peppers. Used sharp cheddar and baked it instead of boiling the peppers first. Will make them again

I changed out tomato soup for a jar of organic spaghetti sauce (no sugar added,) added "fire-roasted" diced tomatoes, and used GF Soy Sauce instead of Worcestershire sauce (which is 40 - 60% wheat), also did not put cheese in sauce, but layered cheese in the pepper with the sauce, and sprinkled cheese on top before putting the "lid" on peppers. Very tasty indded!

Good and easy! 
I've made this recipe 2 times because my husband LOVES it! It is a quick and easy meal and freezes well. The recipe says it makes six peppers but keep in mind what size peppers you are using. The first time I made it I got four. The 2nd time I got 5. To get six you need to have peppers on the smaller side. I did make one change out of laziness. Instead of the tomato soup, I just put ketsup on top and it was very good. This is a KEEPER!

Yummy recipe! I used both red and green peppers and I also diced up the tops of the peppers and added that to the meat mixture. My son put a pice of provolone cheese on his at the end. We all liked them! Will make again- might put some corn in next time too.
I made it with Turkey meat I also made some adjustment with the seasoning. I will definitely make it again.
Yes I made it!! I added brown rice I had left over, it was delicious and very moist. I used red peppers instead because I don't like green peppers!
Turned out great.

Delicious! I made mine with ground turkey, 
gluten free rice, and a mixture of shredded 
mild cheddar and mozzarella. It was fantastic! I will definitely be adding this to our favorite receipts.

Wonderful recipe! So “down home”. I made one change - I didn’t have tomato soup, so I used a can of tomato sauce mixed with a small can of Rotel tomatoes. Delicious. We ate leftovers for two days, they were so good.

This is the best Stuffed Green Peppers recipe I have ever tasted. It is awesome! Once again and this is now on my meal rotation we like it so much. 
We also found that cutting the peppers in half makes it a little easier to eat. :)
Made rice on the side with chicken broth in Herbst
Excellent...!!! Easy to make!!!

Thanks for the base line recipe...I followed the amount of beef and onion and Worcestershire but I used a can of fire roasted garlic diced tomatoes and added it to the meat and rice mixture. A little salt n pepper. I skipped the cheese and I loaded up halved peppers got 10 instead of 5. And poured tomato sauce all over them. I made sure I had enough sauce for my mashed potatoes. It was soooo good!
I love making these !! Super easy and yummy

Loved the tip to boil the peppers before. I used Italian sausage instead and added red pepper flakes. I would only use one can of tomato soup next time. I added garlic to the onions and meat. I also broiled cheddar cheese on top of the peppers for the last five minutes of baking.
Really great, I used colby jack combo and it was delicious .
I made this & without boasting, it was very good, it has won a place on my favorite recipe list!!
